revised_title: Osborne Reynolds: A Pioneering Figure in Fluid Mechanics and Engineering
tldr: This article celebrates the centenary of Osborne Reynolds' landmark paper on the dynamical theory of incompressible viscous fluids. It provides a detailed overview of Reynolds' life, work, and contributions to the fields of fluid mechanics, engineering, and science. His experiments on turbulent flow, hydraulic modeling, hydrodynamic lubrication, and heat transfer have laid the foundation for many subsequent studies in these areas. Reynolds' work is still relevant today, and his ideas are reflected in concepts such as the Reynolds number, Reynolds equations, and Reynolds analogy.
